meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a prat when he tries to juggle with eggs.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a prat and forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The prat at the party kept telling jokes that no one found funny.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a prat after realizing she had been wearing mismatched shoes all day.
meanings.sent5: Being a prat in class will only lead to trouble and embarrassment.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or stupid manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't prat around when we are trying to focus.
meanings.sent2: He tends to prat about instead of getting his work done.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to prat around the park instead of going home.
meanings.sent4: She knew she had to stop prating and start taking her responsibilities seriously.
meanings.sent5: If you continue to prat, you will never achieve your goals.

meanings.sent1: After sitting for too long, her prat started to ache.
meanings.sent2: He slipped on the wet floor and landed right on his prat.
meanings.sent3: The baby's prat looked adorable in the tiny diaper.
meanings.sent4: She wished she had worn warmer pants as the cold wind nipped at her prat.
meanings.sent5: The cyclist felt the impact on his prat as he fell off the bike.
